## Gentle Machine Learning

## Principal Component Analysis

library(datasets) library(ISLR) arrest = USArrests states=row.names(USArrests) names(USArrests) \# Get means and variances of variables apply(USArrests, 2, mean) apply(USArrests, 2, var) \# PCA with scaling pr.out=prcomp(USArrests, scale=TRUE) names(pr.out) \# Five pr.out$center # the centering and scaling used (means) pr.out$scale \# the matrix of variable loadings (eigenvectors) dim(pr.out$x) pr.out$rotation=-pr.out$rotation pr.out$x=-pr.out$x biplot(pr.out, scale=0) pr.out$sdev pr.var=pr.out\$sdev\^2 pr.var pve=pr.var/sum(pr.var) pve plot(pve, xlab="Principal Component", ylab="Proportion of Variance Explained", ylim=c(0,1),type='b')

library(dplyr) library(ggplot2) library(RColorBrewer)

computers = read.csv("https://raw.githubusercontent.com/guru99-edu/R-Programming/master/computers.csv")

rescaled_comp \<- computers\[4:5\] %\>% mutate(hd_scal = scale(hd), ram_scal = scale(ram)) %\>% select(c(hd_scal, ram_scal))

ggplot(data = rescaled_comp, aes(x = hd_scal, y = ram_scal)) + geom_point(pch=20, col = "blue") + theme_bw() + labs(x = "Hard drive size (Scaled)", y ="RAM size (Scaled)" ) + theme(text = element_text(family="Georgia"))
